page.title: 14Buildings: Weekley,Kettering
page.content: Close to the church are some former almshouses which were originally known as the {Montagu Hospital}. Dating from 1611 they were built by the 1st. Lord Montagu to house 6 old men from the neighbouring villages who had no one to look after them. The architecture is imposing with a large gable, obelisks, sundial, coat of arms and inscription- "WHAT THOV DOEST, DO YT IN FAYTH". We are reminded that "Tempora labuntor tacitisque senescimus annis" - time slides by and we grow old with the silent years. A {Jacobean Free School}, now a house and once the vicarage, is close by. Built by the same Lord Montagu the inscription reads: "A FREE SCHOOL FOR WEEKLEY AND WERCKTON FOUNDED BY NICOLAS LATHAM CLERKE PARSON OF BARNEWELL S.ANDREW TO TEACH THEIRE CHILDREN TO WRITE AND READE." ANNO DOMINI:1624.
